1) Pulled-Pork Arepa - my BF got this and disliked the fact that it was heavy on sauce and made the corn bread really soggy./messy. The sauce was also too spicy for him - and he usually takes spicy pretty well. So if you can't take spicy - ask them for less sauce or sauce on the side. 
2) Grilled Chicken Arepa - came with avocado and black bean sauce also. I think this on was pretty good, but since the corn wrap is a little thick - it taste a little bland, but you can spice it up with their 3 selection of sauces. 
3) Yuca fries - These are not your typical fries! Yuca are roots - so the taste is a tad different than potatoes. They taste great with their red sauce. Get this as a side, because 3 yuca fries and my arepa definitely filled me up.

In addition, to their arepas, they also have bowls, salads, and these taro and plantain chips with meat and sauce I'm so coming back for to try! 

SERVICE: 
Friendly and effective. I can tell the food could take awhile to come out if this place was packed. 
 
AMBIANCE: 
Very festive and culturally decorated. A lot of natural lighting from the window which is great. Most seats are for parties 4-6 and single seats by the wall. Not the most spacious place, but decent sizes. 

Overall, great place to try if you want to try a different variation of mexican food - latin american food in this case. Food was pretty heavy for me haha. But  I will be back to try their taro and plantain chips!!!
author: Samantha F.

description: I feel like this is the kind of place that looks mind blowing on paper, but doesn't quite get there. I really love arepas and Pica Pica's version are pretty good. Depending on what you get they can taste vastly different. It's also a little too heavy and greasy for my taste. I wish them all the best though!
author: Dexter H.

description:
My local favorite! Delicious. Healthy. Gluten-free. Clean Eats. And Cheap. What more can you ask for? This place is legit! Super chill atmosphere. Order at the counter, grab a number, and they bring you your perfect meal. 

The Beef Pabellon with sweet corn and Crispy Chicken with sweet corn arepas were both delicious! I want to try everything on their menu... seriously! Their house made sauces and fruit infused water were nice complementary bonuses! Loves it.
author: Ellen W.

description:
Soggy overpriced mess.

We ordered three items for delivery. Everything was soggy and both the chicken and pork were overcooked and flavorless. Some of the sauces were good, but there was nothing worth eating them with. I don't know if this is common given all the good reviews, but it was bad enough that we'll never try it again.
author: Kartik S.

description:
Good, but not amazing. Didn't love the Spicy Chicken (too tomato-y), preferred the Crispy Chicken. In retrospect, maybe we should have gone the beef or pork route.

Everyone should definitely order the garlic yuca fries though. So so so so so good. Get a basket instead of just a side of it. 

I wish the tables were cleaner overall, but I guess that's what happens at places where you bus your own tables.. But I think they should still have someone go around and do the occasional wipe down.

I'll also be honest, I'm a little bit salty about this place because the ledge that the silverware on is SLANTED. And I put my coconut lime juice on it while juggling my bags without noticing it was slightly slanted and my juice slowly slipped off without me noticing and spilled. I know I shouldn't expect it, but MOST places I go to, they would have just given you another one. And I know I shouldn't expect it, and honestly I'm happy to pay for another one (I did), but here they just asked me if I wanted to buy another one. Made me more frustrated than I already was. Especially when I originally had wanted the lemonade and they'd run out of that.
author: Ashley S.

description: Pica Pica came onsite to my work and so glad they did! The arepas are delicious - I tried the beef with cheese and pulled pork in white corn pockets. Both were so flavorful and delicious! I had never tried arepas before and these didn't disappoint. Will be trying the restaurant at some point!
author: Connie Q.

description: We ate hear a few weeks ago. Food was very fresh, arepas where tasty and crunchy and there are many options for filling. The beans tasted homemade. The menu is a bit confusing so we had to ask a lot of questions but eventually ordered food we were happy with. Seating is limited but people do clear out fairly quickly. Service was amiable and efficient. We will definitely return when we are in San Francisco.
author: L. A.

description: This place has some really good food, I especially love their sweet cornbread and spicy sauce over pulled pork. It's a little hole in the wall but I am not disappointed and think you will enjoy this place.
author: Robyn M.

description: Food was delicious! My husband has Celiac (ie severe allergy to gluten) and Pica Pica is naturally 100% gluten free. I can't tell you how nice it is to find a restaurant where you don't have to worry about your husband becoming sick from cross contamination. This wasn't just good "for being gluten free," it was just plain yummy regardless of gluten status! We had the ceviche, nachos, garlic yuka fries, and empanadas. They also have certified gluten free beer which is hard to find. The Latin cab was good too. We will definitely be back!
author: Nishi P.

description:
I haven't dined here so this review is only for the food.

My team at work ordered food here for delivery for lunch on Friday. Everything on the menu looked delicious but I ended up ordering the Shredded Beef Pabellon Capacha.

I really like plantains and I really like crepes so I decided to give this a try. It was so delicious and I made the right decision ordering this! It is a crepe made from fresh sweet yellow corn and the filling consists of plantains, shredded beef, black bean puree and cheese with a side of spring salad. The combination goes really well together because the sweet corn crepe balances out the savory shredded meat and bean puree. 

The portions are pretty big too! It was two meals for me and they are really generous with their meat portions. Each bite has a lot of meat.

I can't wait to visit their actual restaurant one day and try the other items on their menu.
author: Allie Y.

description: Beware: if you order food for take-out to be picked up (not delivered), you will be directed to order through the caviar app. When I picked up my food, I noticed the prices on the menu were at least a dollar less than the prices on the app's takeout menu. When I asked the cashier about it, she said, "I don't know." Not exactly the most helpful customer service, which would have been "I'm sorry, let me take your number and have the manager help you." Regardless, pretty shady business practice, won't be ordering again.
author: Melissa G.

description:
We stopped in here as we were waiting on the guest list at another restaurant (lol!). We were pleasantly surprised that they had a couple vegan options. We ordered the vegan Plato and it was great! The service was kind and prompt. It also should be noted that they have PLENTY of gluten free options too. :) 

My boyfriend absolutely loved it so I'm sure we'll be back!
author: Madeline F.

description:
After seeing Pica Pica on D&D, we were very exciting about dining with them while on our vacation to San Francisco. We found the food was very overrated and very overpriced. Although we wish them much success with their business, we were not at all impressed.
Pork was dry and needed the sauce they leave you on the table. I was expecting some flavor in the shredded pork! Our table had no napkins. 
Disappointed :/ dropped in on 2/18/2016
author: Kate M.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I would eat here everyday if I could but then I would be broke. Almost $30 for one arepa and a side of fried plantains. Just stating facts we have to make a living in SF so I understand. I found this place while doing a shoot in SF and the got catering from here after finding out that all of there options are gluten free I was hooked. Can't wait to come back. I love you Pica Pica.
author: Bre M.

description:
Absolutely loved this place. Totally casual vibe, yet the food was gourmet and delicious and just totally dug it.

Will definitely become a regular here.
author: Sean B.

description: Worked with Lucy in a catering order for an in-office work lunch. Process was smooth and easy from beginning to end!  Food was ready when I walked into the restaurant and was even better than expected. We did the nacho bar for 10 and ordered 12 of the mini arenas. Plenty of food for 12 people and we still had leftovers. The taro chips are the perfect base for these nachos and the sauces perfect compliments. Thank you Lucy and pica pica!
author: Kate W.

description: Super excited that everything on the menu is 100% gluten free! Delicious without worries!
author: Summer S.

description: This Venezuelan gem was delicious!   I highly recommend the arepas and the cachapas.   The garlic yucca was yummy too!
author: Christine A.

description: Very good overall, arepa was really good and filling. The sauces were also really good. The juice on the other hand was ok not the best felt more like if it came straight from a bottle. Wish a little more effort was put into the drinks. Be mindful the lines get very long there.
author: john l.

description:
Arepas!  I first tried Pica Pica at the SF Weekly DISH event at the Metreon.  I wanted to like you arepas BUT you just didn't wow me.  The Pernil (Shredded Roasted Pork) was somewhat bland.  

I do like their location on the corner on Valencia Street but gave you arepas a 2nd chance and you failed me again.  The corn cakes are good but the protein and filling not so much.  Like I paid $10 for plate of curtido and corn cakes only!  Best arepas I've had were in Chicago and I'm still thinking about THOSE arepas sadly.    

For now I would just stick with the hand cut yucca fries which are delicious...if I strike out on the arepas again next time.  They have a variety of sauces you can dip it in.
author: David C.

description:
We have been wanting to visit this place for the longest time! We had tasted some plantain and taro chips with a yummy chicken avocado dip at an event and wanted to try more. 

The place is smallish but the turnaround is very quick. By the time we finished ordering, a couple of spots had opened up and we were able to sit down and enjoy our food. Both of us got arepas and the spicy chicken arepa was really tasty! They also have a couple of sauces and aioli on the tables in case you feel you need more. The side of plantain and taro chips with an avocado dip was pretty generous. Everything tasted really fresh and flavorful. I will return to try some of the other items.

The veggie items on their menu are also vegan so it's a great spot for vegans!
author: Shriya P.

description:
What a horrible experience at a place that claims to be allergen-friendly. The food itself was very good, but if you have any food allergy or intolerance besides gluten I would be very wary of trusting what they tell you is in/not in the food..

I have celiac and I can't eat gluten or dairy.
The first time I went I had what I thought was a good experience. I asked if the food I ordered contained dairy (especially the aioli) and she told me it was dairy-free and was made of just olive oil and herbs. This past time I went I ordered the same meal, asking again to make sure it was dairy-free. This other person told me it was once she removed the aioli.. When I asked if the aioli had dairy in it, she replied yes and moved on. 

I ended up feeling so unsafe eating the food, as I didn't even know what was in it.. Nor did it seem anyone who worked there knew what was in the food. It wasn't listed anywhere on the site or on the menu in person whether items were dairy-free, or other allergen-free, so the cashier can tell you anything she/he wants...

Also when I got my cachapa, it looked like there was still aioli smeared on the bottom of it, though I guess I can't be sure...

Just take caution.. I've had stomach problems after eating there both times, who knows why..
author: Sam W.

description: Cute little place. Loooved the spicy chicken arepa. I've heard the pork one is mind blowing. Plan on checking that out next. Central location if you're walking, biking etc... driving not so much as parking can be a nightmare.
author: Catalina V.

description:
Beautiful interior and exterior on this place. I think its possible anybody get lured in by the mural on the exterior.

High ceilings inside and the art theme continued on the inside. Very visually appealing. Simple floors that seemed to work.

Its in a sketchy neighborhood and there is a scary alley right behind this place. Not the cleanest looking restaurant I've ever seen but it could be I just came after a large dinner rush.

There is self serve water and the kitchen is visible to the patrons. I like that... it means they are less likely to try any funny stuff with so many eyes watching (I always hear these kitchen horror stories on the news).

Utensils are easy to find on the tables... don't expect special service here... but you do get reasonable prices on arepas - ground maize dough - similar to Mediterranean cuisine.

Tip: tell them to go easy on the sauce if you don't like it soggy.
author: Stefan T.

description:
Was in the city looking for dinner options. These folks know their food. Delicious gluten dairy and soy free authentic food. To read more visit my page.

https://www.facebook.com/CookHealNourish/posts/330901890668985
author: Reshma M.

description: This place is great for a quick bite or casual meal. I had the crispy chicken arepa with traditional white corn and it was delicious. The flavor and texture of the chicken breading reminded me of Cajun style catfish. The corn arepa tasted fresh and well made, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I look forward to coming back.
author: Derek K.

description: Overpriced and not impressed. Won't be trying it again. 11 dollar for small portions of pull pork Arepa that's not very exciting served with a tiny side of coleslaw that had way too much mustard seeds in it that added too much bitterness. Service fail because all she had to do was take orders and bring out food, yet she mess that up because she is not listening or focusing on what the customer is saying. I say this because she messed up 2 orders in a row. The food is not bad but it's not 11 dollar great.
author: Tony N.

description:
This was actually kinda of amazing.

As the closest restaurant to where we parked the group vote was to drop in here, and we were all very glad we did!

The honey and I both ordered the pulled pork pernil, which was just mouthwatering and delicious. I expected different maze, but this was, as our friend said, like an open faced tamale. The pulled pork was piping hot and seasoned very well.

My pernil was a tad over-spiced for me personally, but I really loved how light it was and the amount of meat you received. That being said, I found it a bit expensive, $10 is just a bit steep for the size of the plate.

However when it comes down to it, it was a fantastic find! We will definitely be back!
author: Meg T.

description: Arepas + Yuca fries!  A Venezuelan Party in your mouth!!
author: S F.

description:
After hearing about this restaurant from friends and watching an episode of DDD, I had to see what all the hype was about. The restaurant is located at a busy corner of Valencia. I found parking right across the street (thought I should play the lotto after that!). There was a short line when we arrived and I happily spent a few minutes reading the menu. Unfamiliar with the cuisine, I couldn't decide. I ordered a pulled pork arepa as recommended by the lady at the counter. It was just ok. It wasn't awful - in fact, it is exactly how it appears. The corn pita (or pocket) was dry, a bit flaky, the avocado gave it some creaminess, and the pulled pork was bland. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing?

The restaurant itself is narrow with seating around 3 walls and the kitchen and restroom taking the space in the back. There are also a few small tables in the middle of the restaurant. It is dimly lit and cold inside so I wasn't really comfortable. Our table wobbled, too.

3-stars. I just expected more and something a little better.
author: Maricel S.

description:
This is one of the few places I've been where I'm thinking about what I want to order next time before I'm even done with my meal.

The Plato was a great sampler. On the sweet side, the rice had just the right amount of coconut flavor, and the plantains were large, juicy, and carmelized - I left some for the end for my "dessert." On the savory side, the tofu was enhanced by the creamy aioli sauce (although I also recommend trying the spicy sauce on the table) and the black beans weren't just plain, but well seasoned with onions and spices. 

It was so delicious I really wanted to clean my plate, but the portions are quite generous and  I was unbutton-your-jeans full. I made mental notes looking around at what my dining neighbors were devouring. Watch out Pica, next time I'm coming for you.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Words cannot express my love for Pica Pica. It was the first restaurant my wife, then fiancée, tried in San Francisco. We were instantly hooked. The arepas, yuca fries, and cheese empanadas are only bested by the sauces. I usually use 3 out of the 4 sauces and have always wanted to buy the orange sauce in particular. I love all of their arepa flavors, maybe crispy chicken the most, while my wife likes the grilled chicken. The meat is so fresh and overall their is a lot of flavor! And it's all gluten free! We love this place so much we had them cater our wedding. They worked with us very well, offering a great product at a reasonable price. We have been back about 5 times since then. Unfortunately their prices have gone up but that has probably barley mitigated their increase in operating cost in San Francisco. The people who work here are all very nice. Even when there is a long line they get through it quickly, without seeming rushed. Limited seating
provides for a more intimate experience with strangers which I enjoy. We love the mural outside and have taken great pictures in front of it.
author: Joshua F.

description: Really tasty, including the sauces, but too expensive for some cornmeal. Seating is very limited and the area is pretty seedy. Parking is a nightmare.
author: John S.

description: Yes I will definitely be back. I've lived in sf my whole life and never ate there before! But when I kept hearing the Colombian vs Venezuelan arepa debate I had never tried Venezuelan arepas so I'm so glad I came across this place.
author: Jenny B.

description: Really honestly the best Venezuelan arepas I've had in California. I love how you can customize your arepa with whatever filling you want. Everything was absolutely delicious!! I will say it was pretty pricey and the place has very limited seating but of course you can always go for takeout instead.
author: Bridget L.

description:
Me and my best friend seen this place on the food network and decided to try it out! It was something different from what we usually eat and I'm so glad we went. The arepas are good!!!! A little pricey I would say but it's filling. We also ordered plantains which were tasty and cooked perfectly. The coleslaw that came on the side was cool and a little tangy which was a perfect contrast to the savory arepas and sweet plantains, flavors were well balanced. 

The only reason I'm only giving it 4 stars is because it was a little pricey but glad we tried it out. I would recommend it to people.
author: Siosiana L.

description:
This place is one of the few places in SF that you could eat gluten free and not stress about the menu. The food here is different from what I've tried in the past, but I love it! We got the pica pica nachos to share and added the condiments that we're sitting on the table (a must) along with the coconut lime juice. SO good! 

The flavors definitely take your mouth on a ride, you must try out the different condiments such as the aioli because it really makes the dishes that much better! Although my sister noticed the prices have raised significantly, we agreed that this place is a still definite go-to spot.
author: Ren S.

description:
Mmmm who doesn't like plantains? Plantains in my arepa? Even better!! Everything we ordered was really delicious. All different kinds of flavors complimenting each other but is not overpowering. Everything, especially the sauces were all very tasty. Although they messed up on one of our arepas, being corn flour instead of white, it was all good. The service provided by Ronald was excellent! We had a hard time deciding what to order, but he was patient enough to help us. 

The only minor con is it might be a little pricey... 5 sticks of yuca was $3!
author: kim w.

description: This is one of the coolest places that I have ever eaten. I have never had Venezuelan food before but this was a fantastic first experience. Being gluten free, this place was amazing because all of their menu options are made of corn so it is naturally gluten free. It is a tiny little place where you order at the counter and bus your own table but it is a fun and different atmosphere. The food was fantastic and there were so many different stuffing options for the arepas I just want to keep coming back so I can try it all!!
author: Sydney H.

description: This place overall was pretty good. The empanadas were so delicious as well as the yuca fries. The sangria had fresh fruit inside the cup which was great! However the cachapa wasn't so great. Of course being married to a Venezuelan you know the difference as well as the gusacaca was more like a guacamole salsa. However seeing the people who come here to eat I understand why some of the dishes had to be Americanized. Overall I would return.
author: Karla S.

description: Actually , I know 2 people who worked there and they said you had rats that they had to clean extra in the morning because rat dropping were on the tables and on the drinks. DONT EAT HERE THEY HAVE RATS!!!!
author: Michelle M.

description: Was in San Francisco for the weekend and this place was on the top of a lot of 'best' lists so we went. UNBELIEVABLE. The arepas were out of this world. Photo posted. Seriously, you have to go here if you are in the area. It's a little messy but soooo good. GO!
author: Josh L.

description:
If you do not love this place, you're not human. 

The Pulled Pork Pernil with a sweet corn arepa is my favorite. I, also, recommend the Shredded Beef Pabellon.
author: Enrique F.

description:
Always some good stuff here! They no longer use their 10-punch cards, which I admittedly had been holding onto for a few years. 

THE WAIT: None on a Friday around 8:30pm. It was busy but we got a couple spots on stools along the wall. 

See my pics for additional details!

* Lemon Coconut Juice - 4 stars
This was great. Slightly heavy on the lemon - I only got a tiny hint of the coconut. 

* Spicy Chicken Catira on Classic White - 3.5 stars
Tasty but incredibly spicy! My eyes were watering. The arepa as always has a good crisp, soft gritty filling.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Having lived in NYC for 6 years, I had Venezuelan food a few times. However, I hadn't expected to find much of it in CA but lo and behold, Pica Pica delivered. I came here on a Saturday evening and got a seat at the counter. I was mildly confused by the menu/ordering system because I thought the arepas would come with something else but if you want sides you have to get those separately. I chose the Pulled Pork Pernil Arepa which came absolutely loaded. I was a little concerned how I would manage to eat this but it wasn't quite as messy as I expected it to be and held together pretty well. The arepas do come with some cole slaw on the side but I also ordered the garlic coconut rice which sounded good. The rice was underwhelming; I only tasted a mild hint of coconut, no garlic so I wouldn't recommend paying extra for it. The arepa was bomb though and I'd love to come back to try the other combinations/flavors.
author: Pooja C.

description:
This place is awesome!!!
Probably one of the most satisfying places I've been to.
I was craving some Colombian food and couldn't really find much, however I came across this place that has amazing Venezuelan arepas.

I got the shredded beef pabellon, which had plantains, black bean puree, shredded beef, and queso fresco.  Wow explosion of flavors in my mouth, I couldn't have asked for a better arepa (btw you do have the choice of sweet yellow arepa or classic white, I got the white).

My fiance got the pulled pork pernil, which had pulled pork, avocado, tomato, pica pun,aioli, and she also got the classic white.  Hers was also pretty delicious.  We also got the fried yuka with garlic, I could've gone without the garlic even though with garlic was pretty good.

Overall this hipster arepa joint its delicious, sure a bit overpriced, but so is everything in sf.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Probably 2 and a half but I rounded down because I feel like this place is overpriced and probably overrated. And the food honestly wasn't that enjoyable. I got one of the arepa s ($10 for one) and it was way too sweet. The meat (I got the beef pebellion) was pretty good but the sweetness of the arepa overpowered everything. The plantains were alright but didn't really go with the rest of the ingredients. I was hoping the sauces would help but I didn't like any of the 3. Sangria was on the sour side and tasted like it had little to no booze. Overall, with the many options around here, I'm not sure I would be back.
author: Seema U.

description:
Everytime I go to San Francisco I have a "food list" - places I want to try that I didn't get to try the last time I was there. Pica Pica had been on that list for a while since a) all the rave reviews and b) there isn't exactly an abundance of Venezuelan food in my corner of the world. So why not? 

I'm glad I got to try it! I'm not sure if it was an off night or this is one of those classic examples where vegetarians just don't see/feel/understand the magic the way their omnivore brethren do, but it was just okay. While the prices are awesome, the food was actually kind of a let down to me:
- Garlic Coconut Rice: we only got this because other reviews said it was so good, but ours had no flavor whatsoever; it was just a big mound of bland, overcooked rice.
+/- Yucca Fries: delicious! SO DELICIOUS. Crispy on the outside, melt in your mouth on the inside, I could have eaten just these all night long but... Iiterally we got five pieces. What am I supposed to do with five pieces (which, by the way, comes out to a dollar a fry)? 
+/- Vegetarian Arepa: I wasn't expecting this to be so sweet. Mine was mostly filled with plantain, so when I did hit pockets of avocado or bean, it was a reminder that this was dinner and not dessert.

Also, the service seemed a bit weird to me. Someone brought our food over to us and insisted it was ours despite us telling them otherwise, so we didn't touch it. About ten minutes later our actual food came to us, so they took the first tray of food away and plopped it in front of its actual owner. I don't know, is that weird to anyone else? I felt badly for the people who got a cold meal. 

Again, off night maybe? Regardless, I'm just not inspired enough to ever find out if it was or wasn't.
author: Steff D.

description:
I went to San Francisco for the weekend and found this place in yelp that had great reviews and decided to try it even though it's was far away from where I was staying. Every time I go to any city I try to find a Venezuelan restaurant because that's my favorite food (I'm Venezuelan). This place was incredibly disappointing! The staff was super rude. The girl taking the other seemed annoyed and was not helpful at all. After ordering I realized this place is actually very expensive. I live in Seattle which is also not a cheap city and most of the places that sell arepas have them for $8. When the food came it was not at all what I expected. I got an Asado negro arepa and it was the worst one I've ever tried and I've been eating Asado negro since 23 years (no kidding) that's my favorite dish. Also who serves arepas with cole slaw??? My boyfriend got a cachapa and the last thing that had was corn. It was basically made with yellow arepa mix and maybe a spoon of corn when it supposed to be made entirely of corn. Also came with a salad (very odd). While we were eating the other girls in charged of cleaning the tables was literally slamming the dishes around to the point where everyone was looking at her. Over all just sad. would not recommend.
Btw there's was nobody from Venezuela in that place. We are normally very nice people.
author: Maria Gabriela C.

description:
Anything you order here is going to be good! 

The food is always super fresh, delicious and comes out fast. 

The chicken soup reminds me of my grandmother's.

5 of us ate here and everyone not only cleaned their plates but had dessert!
author: Bianca U.

description:
My wife and I stopped in after seeing this spot on DDD some time ago...
We came into the city on BART and was my wife nervous walking the 2 sides of a city block where this restaurant is located....
But the food was fantastic!
I'd love to have tried more of their selections.
We had their pulled pork on a sweet corn arepa, yummy and we had differing opinions on the accompanying slaw, I liked it and she didn't care for it. Still a great dish.
author: Mark P.

description:
- Grilled chicken arepa: Super tasty flavorful and moist chicken, served in an arepa that's thick and lightly crusty

- Yuca fries not as amazing - tasted pretty oily to me

Very casual spot, great for lunch. Would definitely come back
author: Kristie C.

description:
Very nice option in the Mission when you are getting sick of burritos. I have nothing else to compare this place to but I will say if I am passing by and I need lunch or dinner I often stop in. I get a craving about once every three months for one of these things.  

When I visit Colombia in a month I will get a better idea of how good this place is. From the looks of the photos online, pica pica looks better than what I see in Colombia --we'll see.
author: H K.

description:
I'm not going to lie, but I had seen a number of negative reviews on this place the first time I looked it up. (After watching the Triple D episode of course)

So I had decided to not try this spot out.

Then I saw that Groupon had a deal for it, and figured what the heck? Why not try it since I'm getting a discount.

Let me tell you...these arepas (being the first ones I'd ever eaten) were superbly delicious. Not knowing to compare them to any other arepas, I really thought the flavors of the pork and Pica pun sauce and the curtido were all so well married.

I thoroughly enjoyed my pulled pork pernil white corn arepa. The pork was flavorful and moist. I tried every sauce with it, and they all sang in my mouth. My only demerit is that the sauce that was put on the arepa by the cook was all at the bottom of the corn pocket, rather than evenly dispersed across the top of the meaty goodness.

My mother, who actually dislikes the cuisine of Spanish (and even Portuguese) speaking countries across the board, completely loved her beef pabellon white corn arepa. She even ate the curtido! Crazy stuff.

I really want to try the cachapas the next time I come here!!!

Even the Yuca Beignets were super yummy, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. The mango fresca was RE-FRESH-ING to the max.

I love this place. And I will definitely come back for the pleasant service, too.
author: Angela S.

description:
Enjoyed Shuli arepas and yuca garlic fries! But just four yuca garlic fries in a serving :( 
Veg ceviche was good but the way it was presented it looked good but was uncomfortable in taking ceviche from the cup using crispy yuca chips! 
Tables are small and lot of space is taken by the sauce holder! Sauces are delish though! 
They could use better biodegradable cutlery! They were useless and killed the joy of relishing the meal! 
Very receptive, courteous and welcoming staff!
author: Mona M.

description:
I came here on a Sunday night at 7pm and the place was practically empty. You order your food at the front, pay, and then seat yourself. 

I've only had Venezuelan food once and it was an arepa, so I opted to try something different. I ordered the pulled pork cachapas and a basket of yucca fries. The fries by themselves lack flavor, but it comes with a side of guacamole and there are also 2 different sauces on the table to try it with. The cachapas are delicious and I love the sweetness of the crepe and the juiciness of the pulled pork.

I was pretty hungry and I was stuffed by the time I was done. I'll definitely come back again.
author: Edward W.

description: We came from out of town and I must say we were not disappointed! The coconut lime drink was refreshing and the soup was so flavorful. The food was something like I have never tasted before.
author: Melissa K.

description: I saw this place on Groupon and decided to check it out. It was nothing too special. We ordered shrimp ceviche and arepas. The food was okay and noticeably pricey! I'm glad we had the Groupon. Also, you don't get a ton a food so I wouldn't come here very hungry. Maybe for a snack on the way to BART or Dolores.
author: Marcie A.

description:
My friend and I visited yesterday to try some of their vegan & vegetarian options. After our poor customer service experience, we will not be back to support this business again. 
The women taking orders seemed very annoyed and tried to be as short as possible with us.
We both tipped well despite her unfriendliness since we were eating in. 
The table we sat at was not clean so we wiped it off. When our food arrived, I realized there were no utensils on the table and she did not provide any for us. I got up to look for one but could only find plastic togo ones (which I always break). I got her attention to ask her for a metal fork. She did a quick look around the other tables and she said "there were none available", did not apologize & just went back behind the counter. 
The restaurant was not busy & the people sitting next to us had metal forks so this was unacceptable to me. You are also responsible for cleaning your plates. 
The food was fine which is why this review is 3 stars but the current system with the option to tip & the lack of service should be changed.
author: Maddie P.

description:
Best Arepas in the Bay Area. Period.
If you are looking for authentic Venezuelan, the only options were ether a flight to Miami or a flight to NYC. With Pica Pica in the mission district of San Francisco, you only need to drive to the city for some delicious modern take on the classic Venezuelan staple foods!

Arepa de Pabellon is a wonderful mixture of black beans, sweet plantains and juicy shredded meat. Yum!!!

For snackers, order yuca frita with garlic sauce or. Empanadas (cheese or black beans). 

Don't forget the juices. They are not smoothies, or your typical Mexican aguas frescas. These are deliciously thick and fruity drinks. All natural.

Oh and all Venezuelan dishes served here are gluten free.

Delish! Will be back!
author: Rob G.

description:
This place is pretty good. I enjoy their shredded beef pabellon arepa, and their vegetariana arepa -- both of those include a combination of sweet plantains + savory other stuff + creaminess (avocado, mayo, etc).

My main complaints are (1) the arepas are expensive, upwards of $11 each; I'm used to paying more like $7-8 per arepa even in expensive cities like NY/SF, and (2) they're such a mess to eat. They're overstuffed, to the point where it messes up the ratio of components you can get in each bite, and you always end up with sauce dripping out the sides. I only come here when I'm dining alone!
author: Anne P.

description: So the place was actually on the food Network and rightfully so. Very colorful interior, with a very welcoming feel to the restaurant. The arepa was one of the best I have ever had. Sweet, perfectly cooked, crunchy, yet soft on the inside. You can get them filled with whatever you want, the pulled beef was excellent, cooked to perfection, moist, juicy and seasoned well, complemented by the sweet plantain and and rounded off but the arepa, I would not change a thing about it. The fried yuca was also excellent, fried to crispy perfection. Come here!
author: Harry P.

description: Calling all gluten-free foodies! I finally found a place that replaces gluten, but not quality or flavor. The Nachos Pica Pica feature taro chips and a unique Guasacaca sauce. The Arepas are grilled corn pockets that are crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. I will be back for the yuca beignets!
author: Francesca C.

description: Solid outing. Everything is pretty good (tops is garlic yucca fries). I would recommend getting the savory yellow vs the sweet white because the sweetness sort of ruined it for me. Empanandas were really solid. Everything else is good.
author: Jon H.

description: I Enjoy Latin American Venezuelan food. The service is quick and super fast! The beef is so tender so if u go get the shredded beef with white corn, the fried plantains really add a component to the entire dish. The slaw comes on the side and really compliments and adds a vinergary taste that balances well. This place is too good! Not giving it a full 5 stars it can get a little pricey. I liked the specials though.
author: Liset O.

description:
Yum!! This restaurant is delicious!! The arepas are so good & flavorful. I recommend the crispy chicken, tejadas and guava agua fresca. It is so nice to have such a flavorful and gluten-free restaurant in the city. 
The vibe is casual and the service is prompt, too. 5 stars!
author: Guvnors M.

description: Absolutely delicious and quite inexpensive. I highly recommend grilled chicken arepa. They are relatively large, so if you are not too hungry, one might be enough. This place is a jam, in an area full of overpriced and way overrated restaurants.
author: Arkady I.

description:
The food is so delicious no wonder Guy Fieri went there. I tried the pork nachos, arepas one grilled chicken on the white corn, one shredded beef on yellow corn, spicy chicken catira and a side of garlic coconut rice. This was split between 3 people and we had a some leftovers. 
Everything was so fresh. The food is not heavy.  Not a lot of grease/oil, cheese. I didn't have that stuffed heavy feeling you can get when you splurge. 
Pork nachos on taro chips. An amazing blend of flavors. The pork is tender and juicy. The taro chips are different and I had to get my head out of "tortilla chip" mode. 
Arepas yellow corn pork with plantain was my favorite.  I wasn't sure at first but as I kept chewing the flavor all blended and then I was hooked. The grilled chicken on white corn was amazing. The grilled chicken had such good flavor. 
Spicy chicken catira was definitely spicy. The chicken was soft, juicy and very flavorful it was a great combo with the corn crepe. 
The garlic coconut rice is just that. You can taste both ingredients. I have never had that combo before but was pleasantly surprised how mild the flavors were. The perfect balance. 
We have put this as one of our top SF spots.
author: Marian W.

description:
I definitely enjoyed my meal at Pica Pica, the staff was friendly and helpful. I can't have dairy and once I mentioned that, the order-taker made sure to exclude dairy from everything else I ordered. So helpful!

People complain about paying $10 for an arepa in other reviews but it was filling enough and it was delicious! We had the beef and plantains and the pulled pork. Both were good! 

The yucca is pretty awesome, too.

I'll be back, for sure.
author: Jess A.

description: Recommended by my boy friends co-worker and our first meal in San Francisco. I looked this place up on Yelp. Mixed reviews, so of course when in doubt check out the menu! The Arepas looked amazing. First time visiting San Francisco and a forever fan. One of the highlights, of course, is eating yummy food. Go big or go home, right? I had the Crispy Chicken Arepa with spicy pickled MOJO, lettuce, jicama, tomato, basil, aoili, & Guasacara and some fried yucca! So, so good with fried Yucca and aoili sauce to dip them with! Winner, winner. The service was a bit slow considering we were the only ones in the restaurant but it's not like we were in a hurry and we ate our lunch at the Japanese Tea Garden so all in all not bad. My stomach was pretty happy! I would not recommend eating the coleslaw, it has to much vinegar an was gross! I wish I has Sriracha or Chalula sauce with me!
author: Teresa I.

description: Delicious!  Affordable-ish (for the quality) super tasty food.  I come here regularly and get the beef arepas.  Mmm!
author: Jordan K.

description:
Came here on a Friday night because we wanted a low key bite in the the area. My food was ok, the arepa favor was there but the chicken was not. Paid ten dollars for the spicy chicken arepa, and got a sloppy corn pocket with three tiny pieces of shredded chicken. Oh and the "greens" were just iceberg lettuce. 

The worst part was that the cabbage slaw that it came with had a long black hair in. I promptly set that aside and did not eat that. 

This place is going to be a hard pass for me.
author: Lucio G.

description:
I am HUGE fan of their cachapas! I got that with grilled chicken! The nachos were also amazing...especially the sauce! 

The fries was meh and some of my friends did not enjoy the vegetarian options. I think you really have to be a fan of plantains to like it.
author: Ramya B.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of the Arepas. Try the spicy chicken one with a side of yucca fries. They are awesome! Real cripsy on the outside, and real moist on the inside.They also have sauces on the tables that are really good. The yellow sauce is by far the best. The yucca fries come with guac, but dip them in the yellow sauce! I could not get enough. I first tried them when they had a stand at Outside Lands a couple of years ago. 

I wasn't a huge fan of the $9.50 price tag for one arepa. I get that they are not that common and somewhat of a novelty, but if they are going to charge that much for one, then it would come with a little bit more than just coleslaw. 

I did like that the menu walks you through how to order, granted that most people would be stuck in trying to figure out what is what.
author: Thielson D.

description: I have been here a few time since watching Guy Fieri on the Food Network.  We live in Michigan, but come to San francisco often to vista our son.  In the past we have loved it.  Yes it is a whole in the wall, but was clean, filled with people having fun.  Some like me, sipping a sangria.  It has been about a year and a half since our last visit.  Maybe it was a bad day for the eatery but everything was wrong.  The cashier was expressionless, it seemed dirty, the four of us were the only table in there, later there was another couple.  It is gluten free which is a bonus for us.  But the side orders of coconut rice were cold and stuck together.  One son liked the yuca fries. I thought I would taste one but for the I think $5.25 price there were only a few, not enough to taste.  I had the white arepa, it was soggy and cold and very sweet.  Yellow is better but not what it used to be.  It all seemed like yesterday's or older food.  I ate my filling and left the dough.  We all order something different.  Grilled chicken, pulled pork, shredded beef and the blackened beef.  All were decent fillings, but not as fresh as they used to be. With so much food offered in the Mission and San Francisco, sadly I will not return.  It is too expensive for that low quality of food.
author: Diane V.

description: This Place was marvelous , I ordered a Cachapa (Chicken)  it was total orgasm in my mouth .. 5 stars for sure , only down part was they should start asking the sauce to be optional , pretty spicy other than that with the spiciness it was still delicious , quick service , pretty dam good place ! I will be back here for lunch when I come to San Fransisco !!!
author: Angelo S.

description: Fast, yummy food con mucho amor (with lots of love)! My boyfriend had never had an arepa & found Pica Pica as a GF (gluten free) place to enjoy. The staff were attentive, welcoming and knowledgable! As diners we prefer quality of food over pretense, and Pica Pica had wonderful good eats--we will definitely come again. We recommended to staff as they were closing to open a location in San Rafael. We think Pica Pica would generate a happy crowd across class and culture lines which Marin County is in need of! Gracias gracias Pica Pica!! Bueno arepas amarillo (yellow/sweet) y blanco (white/classic), coleslaw, plantanos (sweet plantain), frijoles negros (black beans), even with 2 arepas and a few sides we were too full to indulge in their lovely-sounding deserts! Besitos!!
author: Marina L.

description:
Don't believe the hype! I came for lunch and was not impressed. Guy Fieri failed me once again. I tried the classic white arepa with spicy chicken and it was bland. There wasn't anything spicy about it and was lacking in flavor. What topped it off was when I picked it up, the bottom side was drenched in the juice so it was all wet. The top of the arepa was filled with spicy chicken but half way through there wasn't any meat on the bottom of the pocket. So I was left with a half empty pocket and didn't bother finishing it.

The garlic yucca fries were decent but were a bit oily and had to squeeze the excess oil onto a napkin. Lastly, tried the shrimp ceviche which was also bland and was lacking acidity. 

The lady cashier was not friendly either. No welcome to Pica Pica or smiles. I don't think I will be returning.
author: James H.

description:
I had seen Pica Pica on Food Network and had to stop in when I was in town. For starters, I walked at least a couple miles out of my way just to be able to stop in. To say I wasn't disappointed would probably be the understatement of the century. 

I got the shredded beef in a sweet yellow corn arepa, my husband got the spicy chicken in classic white, and we shared garlic yuca fries. I loved that there were three different sauces on the table and each added it's own special touch. The slaw that came with my arepa was flavorful and refreshing, and I loved every bite. Now to the arepa!  It was spot on. Grill marks on the outside and tender on the inside. The beef was flavorful and tender, and the plantains gave a wonderful sweetness that kept me wanting more. I snagged a bite of my husbands and loved the bold flavor of his spicy chicken. I love yuca, and these were hands down some of the best I've ever had. So fluffy on the inside, and a nice crunch on the outside. 

If you are even remotely in the area, you owe it to yourself to stop in.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Gluten-free and fabulous naturally!  
I took my best friend here, she is gluten intolerant and a vegetarian.  Needless to say it is usually hard for her to enjoy eating out.  Eating at Pica Pica was like hitting the jackpot for her.  She could have so many things on the menu, she was virtually overwhelmed with joy.  She ate to her hearts content with no reactions whatsoever.   Yea!  We'll be back.  Thank you, Pica Pica
author: E M.

description: A visit to San Francisco is incomplete without a visit to Pica Pica, even if it is in a out of the way location. We heard about them on Diners & Drive-in and first visited them in the Napa location which unfortunately is now closed. The food is great and unique. We are hooked on Arepas! Only thing preventing 5 stars is that sometimes the customer service is not that great. The owner is awesome and inviting; that needs to be the case for the others waiting on customers.
author: Bob B.

description: So good! Lots of food and gluten free :) the workers were helpful and the environment was great. Thanks for making an entire gluten free restaurant :)
author: Marandah V.

description:
I used to live in Miami, so I was super excited to see a Venezuelan place to feed my craving for a taste of home.  Arepas are my gluten-free secret weapon at home, but I never actually tried the Venezuelan ones.  I always make Colombian, and Venezuelan food was all about the empanadas for me.

You must know that this place was jam packed!  The line was long and people were watching like hawks to nab some seating, which was quite limited.  They got through the lines pretty efficiently. I got the lechon (roasted pork) arepa.  The arepa was tender, light, and fluffy like a gluten-free cloud that fell down from the heavens.  It was divine!  The filling, however was aiiiiight.  It was a bit bland for me.  Lechon should be a flavorful kick in the pants, but this was just a touch of flavor and no real zip or characteristic garlickiness.  It wasn't awful, but just pretty good.  It was nothing I was dying to have again.  

Don't let me forget about the root vegetable chips.  No good.  They were super bland and cut way too thick for being the extra dense variety of vegetables they were.  They were also cooked too dark and had zero salt it flavor at all.  The "guasacaca," which I have made before, was just regular old guacamole. No, they are not the same.  They were super funny about giving it out too.  They had forgotten mine and they were all debating about it in Spanish, like it was gold.  It's just the tiniest little spoonful that you get anyway.

For me, the arepa was the stuff of dreams, but the filling needed work.  The aguas, however, were the bomb.  The guava was refreshing and sweetened just right.  I would certainly go back just for that.  As for the food, everything was pricey and the flavor didn't really make up for it.  However, if you've never had the real deal, or if you're scared to venture out and try something new, it'll do the trick.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Stopped in before the dinner time rush with friends. We each had the yellow corn arepas, crispy chicken, pulled pork and the shredded beef.  They were simply delicious!  They were a little on the small size for $10 though. We also had the sweet plantains and garlic coconut rice as side dishes. The plantains were soft and sweet, excellent!  The rice was well cooked, fluffy, not sticky but lacked flavor.  Would not order the rice again. We also tried the yucca beignets with caramel sauce, again, excellent!
The coconut lime fresca was to die for. So good and naturally sweet.  Also, I love that everything is gluten-free!!  I will most likely return. The food and service was top notch. Not much seating space unfortunately and parking is scarce.
author: Kim H.

description:
Saw this place on Groupon and thought I would give it a shot. The place is pretty small but has communal tables and is conveniently located by BART. The staff was so sweet and patient, made great food recommendations and did not hurry us out even though we were chatting past their closing time. 

The food itself is excellent! I got the Spicy Chicken Arepa, my friend got the Vegetarian and we shared some garlic yuca fries. The chicken was pretty spicy and has a good kick to it. The veggie had Tofu and plantains and was a little on the sweet side but still super filling. Some of the sauces are pretty spicy so definitely try some before you douse your food in sauce. Overall excellent place and I am one happy customer!
author: Rachel N.

description: Pica Pica was good. My arepa had a good amount of meat, but it was all towards the front and fell apart at the end. The menu is unique and fun to try, but it was pretty expensive for the amount of food you receive.
author: Lauren A.

description: Came here today for the first time after seeing it on Triple D. The place is small. We ordered the empanadas as an appetizer.They were very Greasy almost to the point of being soggy. Hubby ordered the Crispy Chicken Plata, it was okay but Sweet.
author: Teresa W.

description: Totally as advertised! Yummy, food arrived as soon as we sat down..Whaaat!?! It was mid afternoon on a weekday so it wasn't crowded.
author: J H.

description: Some of the dryers chicken I've ever chewed/threw and half cooked hall frozen yucca make for a yucky experience. Disinterested staff.
author: Anthony S.

description:
Jeez, pricey!  $10 for a single arepa.  Granted the arepas are slightly larger than your average, and I know this is San Francisco, but for an order-at-the counter spot, I was expecting something closer to $10 for 2 arepas, and also the posted menu stated "arepas" which was ambiguous.

We ordered takeout.  You can choose either sweet yellow corn or white corn arepas--the sweet one is pretty sweet, and I liked it.  The white one was comparatively more dry and tasted healthier.  Both were nicely grilled.  Each came with a couple bites of dressed tangy cabbage salad.

Pernil (spicy pork, avocado) ($10) - tasty and good portion of non fatty meat.

Spicy Chicken ($10) - good, but the spiciness factor just came from the creamy hot sauce that is on the tables--that sauce is pretty spicy, so taste before you douse.

Overall good, flavorful food, but just manage your expectations for the price-quantity.  Portion size is good for a slightly heavier snack, so if you're looking for a meal, be sure to order something in addition to an arepa.
author: Vanessa O.

description: My first time trying their Arepa sandwiches and although they use quality ingredients, some of the seasoning/marinades were quite bland and the Arepa pocket was a bit thick and doughy. It was a big mouthful just to take one bite, so the effort was not really worth it in my opinion. Much overrated food and place.
author: Vinh T.

description:
Friday night with the girlfriends led us to Pica Pica. First time having Venezuelan food, we opted to share everything.

Garlic Yucca Fries: 5/5! Super crispy outside with super soft inside. The consistency was almost luke mashed potatoes. The hint of garlic and the aioli were perfect complements. Must get!

Nachos Pica Pica: 5/5! Yummy! Taro chips with pulled pork,  black beans, cheese, tomato, Guasacaca sauce. Huge portion! 

Pulled pork with white arepa: 4/5! The pulled pork was tender. Flavors were good. Pretty small though. 

Fried chicken with yellow arepa: 4.5/5! This arepa was more memorable. The fried chicken was tasty. The yellow arepa is on the sweeter side. A bit too sweet for our taste, but made an interesting combo with the savory chicken. 

The only downside is the small space. Luckily, we managed to snag a table and later moved to a bigger table.
author: Marti L.

description:
Props here for being 100% gluten free, any celiac will feel safe eating here. I got the yellow corn arepa with beef, nachos, and the corn crepe with crispy chicken. The corn arepa was disappointing, to say the least. The corn shell was barely crisp on the outside, although grilled, and mushy on the inside. The worse part of this was the beef that had so much watery sauce that it leaked through the arepa and made it impossible to eat. The sauce disintegrated the arepa and made everything fall apart. Is this the arepa's fault or the beef? I think both.  

The closest thing I can say to describe the arepa is that it's like a very, very dense cornbread with meat stuffed inside. I wish the arepa held the integrity of its shape as a pocket more to allow me to actually eat is as... you know a stuffed pocket (kind of like Mediterranean pita pockets in concept). Another thing was that the flavors didn't blow me away - they were good, there's no doubt about that, but not something that would make me want to come back. 

The nachos ... were a good combination of salty, sweet, spicy. It was a tad bit on the salty side though. Another problem was that the taro chips got mushy REALLY quick and weren't crispy. Again, there was so much watery-something (juice from pork? beans? something?) that flooded the bottom of the nachos which doesn't help. I don't think taro chips stay crispy for long though so I won't ding them too much on this. I wish they could address why their dishes seem to be swimming in pools of water/sauce...

The coconut lime agua fresca was really good though, but a little on the sweet side! Coconut cream mixed with lime so you get a bit of zesty sour tang with sweet, sweet coconut. Kind of like a non-alcoholic pina colada lol. I'd definitely recommend this if you like coconut.
author: Melody L.

description: All I have to say is this place is AMAZING.  The food was outstanding and it was my first time having an arepa, will be visiting again soon.  Everything was gluten free and is a safe bet for celiac folks!  I had the spicy pulled pork arepa and I had the yucca fries, a perfect meal after being adventuring around the Mission all day.
author: Davis M.

description: Casual, quick and very yummy. Totally gluten free and wig vegetarian and vegan choices. Small seating area (space for about 20 people total).
author: Danielle M.

description:
Always excited to try something new. Self serve services. Order and get your number. The restaurant is small. They have about 6 tables and some counter seats as well. I came with a group of 4 around 630pm on a Friday evening. Waited about 25 mins for a table because all the tables were taken. Once we got a table we order. Lucky we waited to order if not, we would be eating standing up. It was my first time trying Arepas. You can choose from white or sweet (yellow) corn. 

We ordered: 
**Garlic Yuca Fries Basket - It was okay, nothing amazing but not bad. There isn't a lot of flavor. It was crispy, but I rather have regular french fries.
**Nachos Pica Pica made with pulled pork, taro chips, black beans, cheese, tomato, guasacaca sauce. - My favorite dish of the night. It was huge. Definitely something to share. I wish the pork had a little more flavor. 
**Pulled Pork Pernil Arepas with sliced tomatoes, avocado, pica pun, garlic aioli. - Wins best presentation. They use the same pork as the nachos. 
**Spicy Chicken Catira Arepas made with mozzarella cheese, greens, tomato, pica'pun. - Not at all spicy. But good flavor. 
**Crispy Chicken Arepas made with pickled mojo, lettuce, jicama, tomato, guasacaca. - Recommend with white corn instead of sweet. My favorite of all 4. The best flavor. 
**Blackened Beef Arepas made with sweet plantain, queso fresco. - It was way too sweet for me. 

We also ordered the Sangria and **Fruit Frescas (coconut and lime). Sangria passion fruit. Does not taste like any others sangria. It was good because I can't taste the alcohol. The coconut drink was good, but you have to keep stirring it because the separation of the ingredients. More lime than coconut. 

Recommend to add the white and spicy sauce together. I use that for almost everything that night. Overall, my experience was just okay. Wish the flavors was more enhanced. People were nice and food came out quick.
author: Sandy B.

description: They messed up our to go order, and we got home to discover that instead of a tasty pork arepa, we got some disgusting soggy vegetarian arepa. Let me clarify: I love vegetarian food, I eat vegetarian all the time, but their tasteless tofu/bean atrocity shouldn't even be on the menu. The other half of our order, the chicken yellow corn arepa, was really good. Service sucks though. It shouldn't be that difficult to get an order consisting of two items right. A disappointing experience, since we were still hungry after we split the one edible arepa.
author: Tatyana V.

description: Good place for a quick bite. Not very good seating for a big party. It's very causal. The Arepas are good and I only liked the pork.
author: Taleen K.

description: I've been going to Pica Pica for a few years and I love.   The food is always consistent no matter what I order.  I love the sweet corn Arepas and usually get that.  The plates are really good too.  The coconut/lime drink is perfect.
author: Deborah P.

description:
If i could give 0 stars i would..
I brought my wife here on a thursday afternoon. We decided to come here because it was her favorite restaurant and on our 10 yr anniversary of course i was going to bring here, and honestly it was the most aweful experience 
First of all, the customer service was terrible. Horrible attitude, i have came before and no one has ever attended us like this.
The food was LATE, we called to reserve but NO ONE would answer the phone.
I would not recommend to come here because apparently the people who work here dont even like their job 
We use to come often, but we will defintely never come back after this dissapointing experience
author: Connor N.

description: Small place. Easy food. Sweet and original arepas are good. I don't like plantains but they make it good. Sauces don't have labels so you don't know what's in them or their flavors. The lightning is a bit white and makes it feel sterile. Good for gluten, dairy, and soy allergies.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Unique good food. Would definitely come back to try more options. The coconut rice was to die for! The beans were okay/good too.
author: Melissa D.

description:
Great place and great food. 
Order the pull pork and grilled chicken one and they were both as good as they looked. Great seasoning and well balanced 

They were pretty quick with the food the only thing that was missing was a good sauce/salsa to put on top.. they do have options but I personally did not liked any of them
author: Eliza B.

description: The cachapas are heavenly. Moist thick yellow corn crepe that is grilled to perfection, stuffed with savory meat. Delectable spicy,sour, and herbal sauces to accompany. Why only 3 stars? I used to eat here all the time,  but over the past few years one major dealbreaker became a factor- the pricing and portions, both of which  significantly changed. A cachapa is now $14.50  without any sides, which isn't enough as a meal in itself. It is WAY overpriced. This is street food which you order at a counter in a fast food atmosphere, yet it is impossible to spend less than $25 for a straight forward meal.  Doable for techsters making $150,000 a year that stare at their phones while they eat, but not us normal folk.
author: Earls C.

description:
Yesterday, I tried Pica Pica the first time. I ordered the classic corn arepa with the Shuli filling.  It was very good and filling.  I will go again.

HOWEVER, while I was seated at a table waiting for my order, I noticed the table top was sticky.  I tried the table to my left and the one to my right.  Both were also sticky.  It's a shame that someone who has taken care to create a nice, neighborhood eatery is sabotaged by someone on the restaurant's staff with careless neglect.  It's so simple to use hot soapy water.

Pica Pica deserves your support.  Everyone go there and test the table tops on the way to placing your order and report to them when you order.  Make America Not Sticky Again !  MANSA!
author: Micky L.

description:
Pica Pica specializes in Arepas. Think giant breaded things stuffed with meat and plantains.

The beef one I got had plenty of meat, along with two giant plantains. The breaded portion wasn't the freshest thing in the world. It wouldn't really come apart with a fork, and it took some carving with a plastic knife to break them apart - I just wound up picking up the thing and eating it that way.
author: Casey S.

description:
I discovered arepas while researching delicious budget-friendly eats for a Las Vegas trip. We didn't get around to trying them while we were in Vegas, but thanks to Pica Pica, we don't have to take a flight to try this Venezuelan delight!! 

Pulled pork pernil arepa with tomato, avocado, pica'pun hot sauce and aioli.
Grilled chicken arepa with black bean puree, tomato, queso fresco and guasacaca (similar to guacamole).
Choice of a classic white or sweet yellow grilled corn pocket.

Consensus - both the pulled pork and chicken meats were tender, juicy and flavorful. The sweet corn pocket was really good. The classic white corn pocket was bland, so I wouldn't recommend it. The pica'pun hot sauce was awesome sauce. It was good enough to bring a bottle home (Retails around $15)

We paid $8.95 on November 2, 2014, but the menu online (at the end of December 2014) shows the price for an arepa has been increased to $9.50. A delicious, filling and gluten-free meal for around $10!
author: Liv K.

description:
I came here around 6:30pm on a Saturday. It wasn't super crowded and my friends and I managed to get a table.

I tried the vegetarian arepa with the sweet yellow corn shell, the vegetarian empanadas, and the yucca fries. They were all delicious! Especially with the aioli and the green sauce.

The menu can be a bit overwhelming at first, but I don't think you can go wrong with whatever you order.

The service was fast!

I'll definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in the Mission.
author: Richa N.

description: Tiny gem of a place with mighty big flavors! My Venezuelan born husband and I always make a point to eat here when we are in the city. Arepa heaven!!!
author: Kelly H.

description:
This place deserves a negative ten! I wish that was possible. 
The worst experience ever!!!
I brought my dad for lunch one about two years ago Father's Day and loved it, so when we came to the city we decided to eat there again, but what a difference, the food was un-eatable greasy and dry! How that is possible I don't know. The soup was a cup at bowl prices, the yucca was so over fried, that it was crunchy on the inside. The black bean tasted like canned beans, the "ceviche" didn't have any citrus yet the shrimp was chalky (had the nerve to slice the shrimp lengthwise only 1 1/2 whole shrimp) and their signature dish, the arepa? Well the masa was heavy and doughy old tasting, the meat tasted burned and old like it's been sitting in the pot overnight. To make things even worse, the entire family felt underfed and we are burping nasty oily PICA PICA food. 
Now the service, it was quick, but when my friend stood up to speak to the cashier, and the cashier got nasty and loud. My friend was complaining about the size of the soup (which was broth, 1/16 of an avocado, a tiny cobbette and 4-5 slivers of shredded beef) the "manager" was rude, disrespectful, condescending and dismissive, she made the situation worse by raising her voice and and being unprofessional. 
I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE EVER.
author: Jae W.

description: Found this place via food network website and glad we did. Absolutely delicious food, very filling. Prices are decent, but not cheap. The shredded beef, blackened beef and crispy chicken arepas were all delicious and the little cole slaw like side salad that came with it was divine. Fresh juices only add to the joy of eating here.
author: Rich N.

description: Went here on a Wednesday along with my daughter. In fact this was my second time - as they had catered to my work a couple of months before that. We had the sweet corn and regular arepas with spicy chicken. It was extremely delicious. We had the yucca fries as well -they were just okay. For dessert we had their coconut flan and  one other item on the menu. Flan was absolutely amazing.
author: Vinoda N.

description: THE BEST FREAKING AREPAS WE'VE EVER HAD. At first we were shocked the price, since we didn't really take time to look at the prices.  But then we realized the arepas are quite large and we could care less how much the food was because it was unreal. I'll never forget this place. Bookmarked!
author: Shaved I.

description:
This is an arepa kitchen but I only ever get the cachapas here because I love the moist, cornbready texture. The first time I had cachapas was at a hole-in-the-wall restaurant in the Bronx, NY. It was so delicious and moist and bursting with corn flavor and grilled perfectly and paired really well with the fillings and I fell in love. I was so sad when I searched for cachapas in NYC and nothing came up. Good thing I discovered Pica Pica because now I can have one whenever I want. Another plus is that it's made with natural ingredients and gluten free. 
The pulled pork and crispy chicken flavors are really good - skip the spicy chicken. Also, be prepared to spend $15+ for your meal - a little pricey for a stop & go spot. And don't forget the sauce!!!
author: Allison Y.

description: We walked 40 minutes to get to this restaurant for lunch, and I would have walked much more!  Delicious food...especially the arepa vegetariana!
author: Carol R.

description: It's not even fair how good these arepas are. Wasn't even a fan of arepas, until I tried these. Can't wait until I'm back in SF.
author: Roger M.

description:
First time trying this food. Loved it! small and intimate space, not very family friendly (tables close by- no baby chairs)
The food was well done and very tasty. 
A must visit place when visiting SF.
author: Madan M.

description: Love pica pica! The yuca fries are perfect (cruchy on the outside and soft & creamy on the inside). Had the yellow vegetarian arepa that was made to perfection w grilled tofu, sweet fried banana, avocado and black bean paste. Very filling and oh so cheap. Def worth a visit!
author: Flavia M.

description: Such a great restaurant. The food is amazing and I ordered with @Allset so my food was ready when I got there. The garlic aoli they have is so good!
author: Ryan J.

description: Had dinner here tonight. Ordered the arepa pulled pork and chicken with yuca fries.  Not bad. Quaint restaurant.
author: P C.

description:
I had some high hopes for this spot after binge watching some episodes of Diners Drives ins and Dives. Damn you, Guy Fieri... you made this place look SO GREAT, MY MOUTH WAS WATERING, I HAD TO GET THERE RIGHT AWAY. 
No rush. 
Came here on a Sunday early afternoon surprised to find it was basically empty (bad sign). I guess it was too early or all the other Mission-folk were waiting in line somewhere for brunch. It is a quick order at the counter service type place. I decided on the Vegetariana Cachapas (yellow corn crepes filled with grilled tofu, avocado, plantains, black beans purée and folded over). The counter staff assured me without the aioli it would be all vegan (yay) and it came with a nice side salad and the dressing was vegan as well. My boyfriend got the Shredded beef plate (with Coconout rice, black beans & sweet plantains). The total came out to around $27.00 without tip (sheesh).
We were the only people in there so the food came out quick and it was hot/fresh. I was just not impressed. My Cachapa was SO GREASY. The tofu was a bit under seasoned and the combination of grease and super sweet crepes with sweet plantains was just kinda over whelming (I added some hot sauce for a bit of heat). My boyfriend said his was good, and the portions were quite filling. I am disappointed in the quality of the food, I was expecting some bold and fresh flavors but was left with a greasy plate of bland food. 
Only redeeming qualities is that this place is clean, service was quick/prompt and I guess it would be a good option if you are looking for brunch when everywhere else in the mission has too long of a wait. I personally, probably won't be back, sorry Guy Fieri, this place does not reflect "flavor town," you have let me down again.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Everything was so delicious and perfectly cooked. Staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend the coconut quesillo!
author: Laurel K.

description:
I have only had Venezuelan food once at a market in London. And oh the memories that came once I bit into this sweet corn arepa here at pica pica. This is also a gluten free paradise as even the chips are either plantain or taro.

We had the shredded beef arepa, garlic yucca fries, and the pork nachos. The little coleslaw that comes on the side is nice because it's not heavy and is tossed in a light citrus vinaigrette. The nacho are HUGE! They offer sauces on the table- chipotle, salsa, and aioli. I'm always big on sauces so I appreciate this. Just know that the aioli is not true aioli and is made with mayo rather than egg whites.  

The place is a walk up and pay at the counter type so it has a very casual atmosphere but it's great if you want something quick Latin American other than Mexican food.
author: Miriam M.

description:
Every time I go this place just feels less and less Venezuelan.

Arepas are still ok; but not as great as they used to be. Most of the fillings have been modified one way or another to be more americanized (I guess??).

Still good, just not great.
author: Gerardo C.

description:
My parents and I were looking for a quick bite to eat while exploring San Francisco and this came up while browsing. I was excited because I haven't had Venezuelan food in years and this place had good reviews.

Menu is simple and clear. Pick what type of arepa you want and your choice of meat. I ordered the Pulled Pork Pernil which was good. I felt like it need a bit more flavor specially for an arepa that costs $10. Place is clean, there was no line and food came out pretty quick. 

Good but not dying to comeback. Way overpriced.
author: Carlos P.

description: The food was okay but the portion size is so small! I thought this would be a good causal spot to grab a bite but if you are hungry you are going to have to spend a pretty penny to get satisfied
author: Reema I.

description: Got two cachapas. The crepe is slightly too sweet to our taste, but the stews were very tasty. The beef is very hearty. The chicken on the other hand is extremely spicy, be for-warned.
author: Norcloud S.

description: The food is amazing.  I was able to try 3 different plates.  No regrets.  Parking sucks but it's worth the walk.
author: Frank I.

description: I would give it a 4 but the service is not warm at all, very cold service. My steps was a little cold and I kindly asked to get it reheated and they wouldn't do it.  Won't go back there at all. #alsooverprised
author: esme R.

description:
I came here because I saw it on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. This place has very unique items on the menu and flavors.  It's an order at the counter and grab a seat place.  We had the nachos with pork and this was yummy.  It's comes on a bed of taro chips. I've not had something like this before.  And we also tried the beef arepa (like a pita sandwich but with a cornmeal pocket). This was also tasty but a bit small.  It came with a small vinegarette type cole slaw which was bit tart for my taste. The yucca fries we ordered were pretty good.  And finally they serve unique fresca drinks and we tried the passion fruit.  A bit sweet and a bit sour but pretty good. 

There are 3 hot sauces to choose from at the tables to complement your food.
author: Ali F.

description:
alright now mission - yeah!
now what's fooder than being food?
nice corn!
i can't taste ya
i said what's fooder than being food?
nice corn!
areparepareparepa
areparepareparepa
areparepareparepa
areparepa ok now mission - yeah!
now we gon break Pulled Pork in just a few bites
now don't have me break Crispy Chicken for nothing
now i wanna eat y'all on y'all's hangriest behavior
lend me some Garlic Aioli i am yo neighbor!
pica pic pica pica
pica pica pic pica pica pica
pica like Arepa Kitchen
ohh ooooooh
pica pic pica pica pic pica
pica pic pica pica
pica like Arepa Kitchen
author: Dan B.

description: We love you! Every time were in San Francisco my wife NEEDS Pica Pica. She will throw a hangry fit if she doesn't get it and I happily oblige! Always delicious! The empanadas are boss! Keep up the great work! Already hungry thinking about it!
author: Zach B.

description:
I am happy to say that the quality and consistency of Pica Pica has returned to 5 stars :) 
I highly recommend
author: oscar o.

description:
I've never had a really great experience with Venezuelan cuisine, but this place definitely took the top spot. The sweet yellow arepas are the best, as the sweet and savory compliment each other so well. The pulled pork was my friend's favorite, but I really enjoyed the crispy chicken. The cachaca was ok, but a bit plain tasting. 

We also shared the nachos pica pica, which is ridiculously enormous and could not be finished even among the four of us. The garlic yuca fries were ok. I've always found fried yuca to be rather bland on its own, and these just had straight garlic on top - no saltiness or other flavors. Maybe great for pure garlic enthusiasts like my friend, but I personally found it a bit lacking. 

Also, the service was great, especially considering it is a counter-service restaurant. The place is small, so we initially crowded around the long bar-style ledge. The staff were very accommodating with all the food we ordered, and then quickly helped us clear a table as soon as one opened up. 

I found it a bit pricey for what you're getting - up to $14 for one arepa, but it was definitely tasty. Good for a casual bite with 2-4 friends.
author: Harris L.

description:
I haven't been here in person, but ordered on Postmates after a friend recommended it to me. It was bomb! The pulled pork arepa was amazing. This was my first arepa I ever had, and I will be ordering more for sure. It also came with lots of zesty sauces. 

My only complaint is that we were one arepa short in the order. I am not sure if that is a Postmates or pica pica problem though.
author: Nikita K.

description: Great food. It's missing the traditional white arepa filled with lots and lots of fresh cold cheese and a little bit of spreader butter. It's also missing Frescolitas. The best part for me is that the arepas themselves are very well made, they taste like down south. The yucas are delicious!
author: Yousef E.

description: What a treat!  Their yuca fries and sauces are amazing along with everything else.  I recommend the sweetcorn arepas with the pulled pork.  So much flavor without the worry of being glutened.  I look forward to stopping at the restaurant whenever I drive through SF.  Totally worth finding parking.  So glad to have them as a gluten free option.
author: Melissa R.

description: My favorite spot to pick up food before heading to Zeitgeist. The sweet corn arepas and yuca fries are amazing! Haven't found another spot like this in SF... a unique little gem in the Mission.
author: Reishi A.

description:
I honestly didn't know what to expect. I've never had Venezuelan food but after this visit I must say its my new favorite.  Came here for the first time on Wed around 430p after work (day before Thanksgiving) and surprisingly there was a few parking spots right in front of the resto. Loved that right away! 

There was no line and only 5 other people dining and seating was not a problem. The lady at the counter was super friendly. Being my first time here, went with her suggestion with the pulled pork corn arepa. Also ordered a side of garlic yuca fries and a passion fruit sangria. 

The order came out extremely quick. Everything about the arepa I thought was delicious! Not dry at all and flavorful. The yuca fries were yummy. I'm a fries person only wish it was double the order haha. That's just me. I was so excited about eating that I forgot to try the sauces. Will definitely try them out next time. 

All in all, I had an excellent experience.
author: Erica M.
